text:
When the sourcebase="..." attribute is used on the rmic task it attempts to 
move the <classname>.java file, which doesn't exist. It should move the 
_<classname>_Tie.java and _<interface>_Stub.java files instead (for iiop.)

I'm not even sure if it is possible to infer the <interface> name for the 
generated file(s).
creator: Mark.Howell@ubsw.com
mike.morris@coco-technologies.co.za
text:
Also confirmed on Linux/JDK1.4b3 for normal (JRMP not RMI/IIOP) rmic. 
FooImpl.java gets moved to ${sourcebase} instead of FooImpl_Stub.java and
FooImpl_Stub gets left behind in the source directory.

creator: bodewig@apache.org
text:
Ant can determine the interface names in the IIOP case - it already does so in
its up-to-date check.

This bug is supposed to be fixed in nightly build 2002-04-11, could you please
both try this nightly build and confirm that it works (so we can close this bug)?
I don't have the proper environment to test it, sorry.

creator: renaud+jakarta@waldura.com
text:
I've just verified this bug using both release 1.4.1 and 1.5, this is what I 
get.

1.4.1 - Error in moving classname.java instead of classname_Stub.java, as 
reported by the original poster.


1.5 - The generated files are left in the base directory where they are 
generated. They are NOT moved to the sourcebase directory. No error message.

Maybe this bug should be re-opened?
